Headline: A Second Look at the Pro-Luna Laws Donors
Text: I used the Sunlight Foundation Influence Explorer API for reporting and built a node diagram with Gephi and Fusion Tables. I wrote the story in a separate post, but would combine the chart and reporting better if I did it again.
Media Caption: Node diagram of donor relationships from an Idaho ballot measure. See story as well.

Headline: Refugee resettlement to Idaho and the U.S. via Tableau vizualization
Text: A Tableau Public visualization of refugee resettlement, nationally and in Idaho showing countries of origin by year. View in context and see other Tableau projects.
Media Caption: Data source: Refugee Processing Center, a U.S. State Department contractor.

Headline: Idaho Complete College Infographic
Text: A basic infographic, with educational data from the American Community Survey, the College Board and the Idaho State Board of Education behind it, prepared for a story on higher ed demographics in The Blue Review.
Media Caption: View full infographic on The Blue Review.

Headline: Family Reluctantly Abandons Home in Settlement of Kfar Darom
Text: KFAR DAROM, Gaza Strip—A year and a half of ignored deadlines, loud protests and international attention didn't soften the blow when Israeli army commander Roi Malchi knocked on the door four times. "You can enter, we are not scared," said Yaakov Goldberg, a father of four and a resident of this tight-knit stronghold of religious Zionism in the midst of the Gaza Strip. [Read More]
Media Caption: On assignment for Knight Ridder in the West Bank.

Headline: Story of O
Text: "The 80,000 strangers at Mile High on Thursday night, who were not really the party faithful as much as the Obama faithful, had about 45 minutes to ponder that between the last "God bless America" and the first shot of Patron." [Read More]
Media Caption: The Idaho delegate call at the 2008 Democratic Convention.

Headline: Sheep vs. Sheep
Text: ENTERPRISE, OREGON -- As we climb out of Enterprise and up the Lostine River drainage in a white Cessna 206, Oregon Fish and Wildlife technician Crystal Strobl picks up a radio collar signal. Joe Spence, a chatty pilot who has flown over the Wallowa Mountains for years, then spots the first band of sheep. They stand in a herd, some on top of a ridge above Deadman Lake, others directly below them, calmly perched on the sheer cliff sides. It's late May.
Media Caption: Reporting from Hell's Canyon for High Country News.

Headline: Latinos in Suburban Idaho
Text: "There are no mid-decade Census estimates that show ethnicity for a place the size of Kuna, and the actual demographic increase is difficult to measure. Kuna counted 261 Hispanic people in the 2000 Census, 4.8 percent of the population. But Hispanics were undercounted across the nation, and by all accounts, the boom in Kuna’s Latino population is only three or four years old." [Read More]
Media Caption: Public radio reporting on Latinos in Idaho.

Headline: Cuba Says Adios to the Greenback
Text: SANTA CLARA, CUBA — Cubans clutching dollar bills and Western Union wire transfers lined up Saturday outside the bank near Leoncio Vidal Park in this bustling town square toward the heart of the island. They came to trade their George Washingtons for notes featuring Ernesto "Che" Guevara and other Latin revolutionaries. [Read More]

Headline: Mexican Joe to Durango Style
Text: "That gringo writers are surprised at the vibrancy of Mexican music reflects a continued disregard for the cultural and other contributions of the state's largest minority." [Read More]
Media Caption: Peer reviewed article in Idaho Landscapes, Vol 4, No. 1.

Headline: Take a Village: A Burundian Woman's Struggle ot Keep her Kids, in America
Text: Sitting on a couch in her sparsely decorated Meridian apartment, Christiana Niyonzima clutches a Christmas photo of her six kids and a drawing her youngest daughter sent her through an Idaho Department of Health and Welfare caseworker. The drawing depicts a stick figure of a girl flying in the clouds with the inscription, written by an adult: "[Girl's name] pretending to fly. Mommy watching." "I think ... I am not sure if they are safe or not," Niyonzima said through an interpreter. "But I know they think of me sometimes." [Read More]

Headline:
Amor & Exile: True Stories of Love Across America's Borders
By Nathaniel Hoffman and Nicole Salgado
Text: Across the United States, American citizens are forced underground, exiled abroad and separated from their spouses for a surprising reason. Amor and Exile is the story of American citizens who fall in love with undocumented immigrants only to find themselves trapped in a legal labyrinth, stymied by their country’s de facto exclusion of their partners. [Read the book]

Headline: Nathaniel Hoffman: A machine readable writing portfolio
Text: Scroll through a decade and half of journalism from Nathaniel Hoffman. Send comments on Twitter or issue a pull request if you have other suggestions.(Made with Timeline JS3.)
